body_html:
You need to send PRs directly against master. The release branches are for our use only. They contain the release bits. The release branches are cut from the master branch periodically, do if you get something into master, it will become part of the next release
…
On Tue, Apr 3, 2018, 7:52 PM Jerome ***@***.***> wrote: So will the said feature be added to tensorflow 1.4? I did notice that my pull request for that branch was closed for the following reason: TensorFlow development is on master rather than any of the release branches, and once there is a release branch, we only accept bugfixes for that branch, so we can't accept this right now. — You are receiving this because you were assigned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#17427 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AT_SbU-cdLbn9RtcVs8kI_86KbfD1Qpoks5tlDVxgaJpZM4SbxHD> .

body:
You need to send PRs directly against master. The release branches are for
our use only. They contain the release bits. The release branches are cut
from the master branch periodically, do if you get something into master,
it will become part of the next release

On Tue, Apr 3, 2018, 7:52 PM Jerome <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> So will the said feature be added to tensorflow 1.4? I did notice that my
> pull request for that branch was closed for the following reason:
>
> TensorFlow development is on master rather than any of the release
> branches, and once there is a release branch, we only accept bugfixes for
> that branch, so we can't accept this right now.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were assigned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/17427#issuecomment-378463490>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AT_SbU-cdLbn9RtcVs8kI_86KbfD1Qpoks5tlDVxgaJpZM4SbxHD>
> .
>
